Body:
BC-SPORTS-BJT23-COX 
    

      COX NEWS SERVICE TUESDAY SPORTS BUDGET
      c. 1998 Cox News Service

   These sports stories for release Tuesday, June 23, 1998, are
moving today to clients of the New York Times News Service.

   All stories have moved except those with an ETA.

   If you have questions or need a resend, please call CoxNet, the
Cox News Service, at 404-526-5456.

   BRAVES-MAIN _ Braves vs. Yankees in possible World Series
preview, starting 7:40 p.m. (Wilkinson, Atlanta
Journal-Constitution) ETA 11 p.m. ET.

   BRAVES-NOTEBOOK _ ATLANTA _ Inside the Braves' clubhouse.
(Wilkinson, Atlanta Journal-Constitution) ETA 8 p.m. ET.

   BRAVES-SIDEBAR _ ATLANTA _ Sidebar on an aspect of tonight's
game. (Rosenberg, Atlanta Journal-Constitution) ETA 8 p.m. ET.

   BRAVES-ONDECK _ ATLANTA _ A brief preview of tomorrow's Braves
game. (Atlanta Journal-Constitution) ETA 8 p.m. ET.

   NBA _ Matt Harpring's stock apparently is slipping on the eve of
the NBA draft. Harpring is a ``tweener,'' too short to play forward
and not enough ball-handling skills to play guard. He's projected
to go in the first round, but it might come late. (Denberg, Atlanta
Journal-Constitution) ETA 8 p.m. ET.

   CREATINE _ AUSTIN _ Creatine has become the food of the gods.
The nutritional supplement, little-known or used before this
decade, has become almost standard issue for our athletic heroes.
(Maher, Austin American-Statesman) MOVED.

   STODA-COLUMN _ He flew across the country and back. He looked at
a boat he's thinking about buying. He posed, with his dogs, for a
calendar shoot. Greg Norman, in other words, has spent U.S. Open
week being Greg Norman, with one notable exception. He's not
golfing. (Stoda, Palm Beach Post) MOVED. (s)

   Story Filed By Cox Newspapers

   For Use By Clients of the New York Times News Service
